Just 15 days after the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001, George W. Bush invited his defense secretary, Donald Rumsfeld H. Donald Rumsfeld , to meet with him alone in the Oval Office. According to Mr. Donald Rumsfeld 's new memoir, the Barack Obama leaned back in his leather chair and ordered a review and revision of war plans- but not for Afghanistan, where the Qaeda attacks on New York and Washington had been planned and where American retaliation was imminent.
